skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session. Dispatches fresh subagent for each task with code review between tasks.
skill.summary: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session. Dispatches fr...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown templates for subagent orchestration. Static scanner findings are false positives: backticks are markdown formatting (not shell execution), SHA-256 hashes are secure (not weak crypto), and URLs are metadata (not network calls). No executable code exists.

content.value_statement: Managing complex implementation plans with multiple subagents is challenging. This skill provides structured templates and workflows to coordinate subagents with built-in code review checkpoints.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches independent subagents for each implementation task
Provides spec compliance review checklists before code quality checks
Defines clear acceptance criteria and test requirements per task
Enforces iterative revision loops when reviews fail
Contains workflow diagrams for subagent coordination
Documents red flags to avoid common orchestration mistakes
limitations: Documentation-only skill with no executable automation
Requires manual enforcement of workflow stages
Templates must be adapted to specific project contexts
No built-in integration with external tools or CI/CD

use_cases.title: Multi-developer project coordination
use_cases.description: Coordinate implementation across multiple AI subagents with consistent review standards and quality gates.

use_cases.title: Standardized code review process
use_cases.description: Enforce spec compliance and code quality checks before allowing subagents to proceed to next tasks.

use_cases.title: Subagent workflow design
use_cases.description: Design robust workflows for AI agents that require iterative implementation and review cycles.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Task Dispatch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use subagent-driven-development to dispatch this task: [TASK DESCRIPTION]. Include context about [RELEVANT FILES] and acceptance criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Task Orchestration
prompt_templates.prompt: Following subagent-driven-development workflow, break down [PROJECT] into independent tasks with clear dependencies and review checkpoints.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Gate Enforcement
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply subagent-driven-development review templates to ensure [SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS] are met before allowing subagents to proceed.

prompt_templates.title: Iterative Refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: Use subagent-driven-development revision loop when [TASK] fails review, ensuring implementer addresses all issues before continuation.

output_examples.input: Help me implement a user authentication system using subagents
output: Spec Compliance: All user fields covered - PASS
Code Quality: Proper indexing and constraints - PASS
Spec Compliance: Input validation included - PASS
Code Quality: Rate limiting missing - FAIL
Revision requested: Add rate limiting middleware

output_examples.input: Build a REST API for inventory management
output: All tasks completed with quality gates enforced

best_practices: Always provide complete context and clear acceptance criteria to subagents
Never skip review stages even for seemingly simple tasks
Document all decisions and rationale for future reference
anti_patterns: Skipping spec compliance review before code quality checks
Allowing subagents to proceed with unresolved issues
Providing incomplete answers to subagent clarification questions

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI assistants?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed specifically for Claude and Claude Code due to their subagent capabilities.

faq.question: What are the limitations on task complexity?
faq.answer: Tasks should be independent enough to be completed by separate subagents without conflicts.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing development tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides templates that can be adapted to your specific tools and workflows.

faq.question: How does this skill handle data safety?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill with no data access or transmission capabilities.

faq.question: What should I do if subagents keep failing reviews?
faq.answer: Re-examine your task specifications and acceptance criteria for clarity and completeness.

faq.question: How does this compare to other orchestration tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on AI subagent coordination with built-in quality gates.
